edu.stanford.nlp.mt.syntax.ghkm
Interface FeatureExtractor

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFeatureExtractor, RelativeFrequencyFeatureExtractor
public interface FeatureExtractor

Collect statistics (e.g., relative frequency estimation, Markovization) on GHKM rules.

Author:
Michel Galley (mgalley@cs.stanford.edu)

Method Summary
 void extractFeatures(edu.stanford.nlp.mt.syntax.ghkm.RuleIndex.RuleId rId)
          Extract features for given abstract rule (we know nothing about its context).
 void extractFeatures(RuleInstance r)
          Extract features for given rule instance (each symbol of the rule links to the AlignmentTreeNode from which it was extracted).

Method Detail

init

void init(RuleIndex ruleIndex,
          java.util.Properties prop)

extractFeatures

void extractFeatures(edu.stanford.nlp.mt.syntax.ghkm.RuleIndex.RuleId rId)
Extract features for given abstract rule (we know nothing about its context). This function may do nothing, and the given FeatureExtractor may rely solely on extractFeatures(RuleInstance) to extract features.

extractFeatures

void extractFeatures(RuleInstance r)
Extract features for given rule instance (each symbol of the rule links to the AlignmentTreeNode from which it was extracted). This function may do nothing, and the given FeatureExtractor may rely solely on #extractFeatures(Rule,int,int,int,int) to extract features.

score

double[] score(edu.stanford.nlp.mt.syntax.ghkm.RuleIndex.RuleId rId)
Score given abstact rule (we know nothing about its context). This function may simply return null.

save

void save(java.lang.String prefixName)
